body:
These threads are usually marked as spam, but Im just making one to prevent the infinite number of threads to come after (give it an hour or two).

But yeah, I quit. I'm not retiring, I'm quitting. I might go into more detail later. Don't ask me why, it's for reasons that I find quite bullcrap in a sense, but you know, that's how it works.

Not quitting Avicus, not re-applying again. I'll be on Teamspeak occasionally in case you would like to discuss anything. But yeah, I quit with my head up high and without the stress of moderator I can enjoy other servers and toast life.

~JP

replies.body:
Yeah, being a mod really seems boring.. ._.
All you want to do is play the game and then some hacker comes on and you have to see if (s)he's really hacking or not, then ban him/her..
I don't know about you, but I'd rather just play and have fun, which is the point of me being on this server.
You made a good choice :3

replies.body:
I don't know what goes on in the staff break room, so I won't say much... .-.
I guess being moderator is quite stressful. I understand, just wanting to play the game without having to deal with duties and small annoyances. If your choice makes you happy, I'm perfectly fine with it.

Promoted for a good reason, demoted for a bullshit reason.
Moderator in a nutshell.
I feel ya bro, I've also been in this situation.

replies.body:
Staff isn't imprisonment, you are however expected to spend a good amount of your time on Avicus moderating.

Being staff can definitely be stressful at times, and sometimes, you just want to run away from all your responsibility.

I can totally see how some people can get tired of it, especially after moderating for so long.

@fishisea
Tino stepped down, he wasn't demoted.
